about_the_game:
Dino Run 2 is the long-awaited sequel to the original prehistoric multiplayer platformer / racing game.



FEATURES

  • Choose from several species to play as, like the classic raptor, rolly stegosaurus, gliding archaeopteryx and beyond.
  • Customize your dino with a huge assortment of hats, helmets, skin colors and patterns.
  • Speed across a dynamically-generated prehistoric terrain, 2D platformer-style. No two levels are ever the same and you often have multiple paths to choose from.
  • Outrun a pyroclastic wall of doom that's constantly on your tail. Slip up or stop to admire the scenery and you just might go extinct. Beat the doom wall and find your sanctuary!
  • Collect hidden super eggs to rack up DNA, used to upgrade your stats between levels.
  • Earn bones and use them to unlock new areas of the game and other perks.
  • Race your friends in multiplayer matches, or just hang out in the lobby and chat.
  • Use sandbox mode to create your own physics contraptions, obstacle courses and mini-games.

FAQ

Q: When is Dino Run 2 getting released on Steam Early Access?
A: We expect the game to launch in Early Access in early 2025.

Q: What's the current state of the game?
A: It's playable, but not enough to warrant a Steam release yet. We have a robust physics sandbox and most of the foundation established. You can follow the development of the game using the visit the website link over to the right -->

Q: How will the game improve on the original?
A: More dinos to play as, more eras to run through, more customizations, greatly improved physics, graphics & audio... check out some concept art below to get a feel for it:
detailed_description:
Dino Run 2 is the long-awaited sequel to the original prehistoric multiplayer platformer / racing game.



FEATURES

  • Choose from several species to play as, like the classic raptor, rolly stegosaurus, gliding archaeopteryx and beyond.
  • Customize your dino with a huge assortment of hats, helmets, skin colors and patterns.
  • Speed across a dynamically-generated prehistoric terrain, 2D platformer-style. No two levels are ever the same and you often have multiple paths to choose from.
  • Outrun a pyroclastic wall of doom that's constantly on your tail. Slip up or stop to admire the scenery and you just might go extinct. Beat the doom wall and find your sanctuary!
  • Collect hidden super eggs to rack up DNA, used to upgrade your stats between levels.
  • Earn bones and use them to unlock new areas of the game and other perks.
  • Race your friends in multiplayer matches, or just hang out in the lobby and chat.
  • Use sandbox mode to create your own physics contraptions, obstacle courses and mini-games.

FAQ

Q: When is Dino Run 2 getting released on Steam Early Access?
A: We expect the game to launch in Early Access in early 2025.

Q: What's the current state of the game?
A: It's playable, but not enough to warrant a Steam release yet. We have a robust physics sandbox and most of the foundation established. You can follow the development of the game using the visit the website link over to the right -->

Q: How will the game improve on the original?
A: More dinos to play as, more eras to run through, more customizations, greatly improved physics, graphics & audio... check out some concept art below to get a feel for it:

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: Any distribution
  • Processor: 2 Ghz CPU
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Drivers with support for OpenGL
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: Any distribution
  • Processor: 2 Ghz CPU
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Graphics: Drivers with support for OpenGL

mac_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • OS: 10.10 or higher
  • Processor: 2 Ghz CPU
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Storage: 500 MB available space
mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • OS: 10.10 or higher
  • Processor: 2 Ghz CPU
  • Memory: 4 GB RAM
  • Storage: 500 MB available space

short_description: A massive sequel to the original prehistoric multiplayer platformer. Select and customize your dino, grab some friends and escape extinction like never before!
